title: The Secret Santa Spoiler
setting: Crestview Publishing, main office, Friday 2 PM
premise: Someone posted the entire Secret Santa assignment list on the office bulletin board, ruining the surprise for all forty employees. The list was in the locked HR filing cabinet.

suspects.name: Brenda Fox
suspects.motive: Frustrated that nobody appreciated the effort she put into organizing it
suspects.alibi: I was in meetings all morning until noon. Then I had lunch with a client at the restaurant downstairs from 12:30 to 1:45 PM. The list was posted while I was eating.

suspects.name: Ivan Petrov
suspects.motive: Got assigned the boss he hates and wanted the whole thing called off
suspects.alibi: I was at my desk editing manuscripts all day. I didn't leave my chair between 10 AM and 2 PM except for a quick bathroom break around 11:30.

suspects.name: Tracy Woo
suspects.motive: Wanted everyone to know she got stuck buying a gift for the intern she just met
suspects.alibi: I was covering the front desk until 1 PM while the receptionist was out. Three visitors signed in during that time and can confirm I was there.

suspects.name: Derek Hale
suspects.motive: Thinks Secret Santa is 'corporate nonsense' and has said so loudly
suspects.alibi: I was fixing the heating unit on the roof from 11 AM to 1:30 PM. My work order is timestamped and the rooftop door log shows when I went up and came down.

clues.title: Bulletin Board Timing
clues.content: An employee noticed the list wasn't on the board at 12:15 PM when she pinned a flyer. Another employee saw it posted at 1:10 PM. The list appeared between those times.

clues.title: Filing Cabinet Access
clues.content: The HR filing cabinet uses a four-digit combination lock. Only Brenda and her assistant Tracy know the code. The lock shows no signs of tampering.

clues.title: Photocopier Log
clues.content: The office photocopier's digital log shows a copy job at 12:52 PM from Tracy's employee code. The original Secret Santa list was a single printed page â€” and the posted version is clearly a photocopy.

hints.text: Consider who had both physical access to the filing cabinet and opportunity during the posting window.
The posted list is a photocopy, not the original. Who might have used the copier around that time?
